title: Vintage Home Heating
description: Remember coal furnaces, radiators, and the milkman-style oil deliveries?

questions.question: What type of heating system used hot water or steam piped through cast iron units placed along the walls of rooms?
Before natural gas became common, what fuel did many American homes burn in their basement furnaces through the 1940s?
What was the name for the metal grate or register in the floor of many homes that allowed warm air from the furnace to rise into rooms?
What type of portable heater used a glowing ceramic element and was commonly placed in chilly rooms in the 1960s and 1970s?
What did families in rural areas commonly burn in a cast iron stove to heat their homes well into the mid-20th century?
What was the purpose of the 'damper' on a wood-burning stove or fireplace?
options: To control airflow and the rate of burning
To add moisture to the air

questions.question: What appliance, often shaped like a flat pan with a long handle, was filled with hot coals and placed between bed sheets to warm the bed?
options: A bed warmer or warming pan

questions.question: What was the occupation of the person who regularly delivered heating oil to homes via a truck with a hose?
What revolutionary home heating technology, invented by Honeywell, allowed homeowners to automatically control their furnace temperature?
What room in the house typically housed the coal furnace or boiler in older homes?
What heating method used hot water pipes embedded in the floor to warm rooms from below?
What small blue flame on a gas furnace had to stay lit at all times and was a common source of worry for homeowners?
What type of stove, popular in the 1950s, burned kerosene and featured a round burner visible through a mica window?
What was the rubber or fabric item filled with hot water and placed under blankets to keep feet warm on cold nights?
What type of home heating system, which became dominant in post-war suburban homes, used a blower to push heated air through ducts?
